job_title: Patient Care Technician in Fort Lauderdale, FL
pros: You learn a lot during your shift where you can't learn in nursing school. I applied for this job because the nurses were my guidance to my future career and they still are today. They have abet me to understand what patient care is and how team work is vital in patient care settings. As a nursing student, I have always strived to learn more and I am by watching how my nurses are conducting themselves with patient during bedside.
cons: I would say one con about HolyCross Hospital is they have a low pay grade for patient care technicians. Usually, we start off $15.00 an hour for day shift and night shift you will have added differentials. Another, down side I see is there is lack of opportunities to grow and enhance your pay grade. I have asked two times for opportunity to grow and enhance my skillset as a patient care technician to see if I can qualify for EKG and Phlebotomy Certificate to enhance my paygrade however, they have declined.

job_title: Patient Transporter in Silver Spring, MD
pros:
Adequate pay
Good for college students or those who want to get their foot in the door of health care
cons:
Not enough workers are on schedule for work in the evening and night shifts, therefore creating the job extremely difficult for those who are scheduled. They are expected to do all the transportation calls that come in, and are chastised when they don't get to the next call as fast as the call dispatcher sends them. The nurses who are waiting for Transport Services to pick the patient up often then call Transport Department or a manager to complain that transport hasn't yet picked up their patient, when in all actuality the transporter is most likely busy with their previous call and not able to get to it yet. I myself have been victim of this time and time again. The dispatchers page me and I call the office, proceeding to them interrogating me as to why I haven't gotten to their third bed transfer within the time span of 30 minutes. This would be the definition of modern day slavery in the American Workplace. The Patient Transporters have the most physically grueling job in the entire hospital, and the treatment and expectations of evening and night shifts (emphasis on evening) is downright despicable.

Management is aware of this and yet does not want to move any morning workers into evening, and the hospital is currently not hiring any outside workers.

job_title: Clinical Nurse in Silver Spring, MD
pros: In some areas staff is very nice and like a family, in other areas staff can be very rude. Culture changes unit to unit. Competitive-ish pay, especially compared to inner city hospitals. Also have generous student loan repayment assistance. It is a good place to get some experience, but go somewhere that treats staff better after that.
cons: Staffing is ALWAYS too low, no matter where you are. Everything is about the budget. Suggestions or requests are never followed through on by upper management. Bad scheduling (forced to rotate days/nights, strict every other weekend). Clinical ladder is too much of a hassle. Off site parking.

review_title: The hospital Needs more people that want to see hospital strive and make change  vs those just want a pay check
job_title: Environmental Service in Silver Spring, MD
pros: The reason why I can't write a lot for the pro is because it has went down hill after the past two years. So my pros are what's currently going on vs what pros have happen in the past . So currently speaking I Have the opportunity to work extra hours and make up your time or make over time.
cons: I feel the company sometimes don't respect others and talk down to each other and over working the current employee they do have and can't appreciate them. Also feel as Under staff and not just my department but the whole hospital

review_title: This hospital does not care about its staff
job_title: Clinical Registered Nurse in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Wonderful, talented, hard working and friendly staff. The pay is good. Smaller community hospital.
cons: Poor nurse to patient ratios on most floors, being short staffed is an every day norm now, nurses have no voice, everyone feels overworked and floor morale has gone downhill on more than one unit. Managers don't listen to staff, only to higher-ups. 2 weeks at a time vacation only, vacation frequently denied, scheduling first come first serve, no 401k matching, benefits are not that great, off site parking. Documentation requirements are out of control, patient safety is really becoming a problem, high turnover rate.

job_title: Eligibility Representative in Germantown, MD
pros: Would-be stressful situations weren't so because of the collaborative nature of the work environment. Co-workers are like family in each department. Compassionate, hardworking, and genuine employees, from admin to clinical staff, Everyone cares and is happy to be there. Lourdes, Elba, Lashon, Jennifer, Janelle, and Nancy in the Patient Services Dept in Germantown are just fabulous. They own that department and keep things running smoothly.
cons:
-internal software (Health Quest) was a outdated, but may have since been updated since I left. That's it, no other cons. 

Some would say having to work holidays and snow days, but that's part of working in a hospital. Professionals in the healthcare industry are needed 24/7, 365.

review_title: Great People. New Co. Unclear/Unrealistic Expectations

pros: Great team to work with 95+% of the time.

job_title: Registered Respiratory Therapist in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Respiratory duties are completely computerized, down to the ventilators.  Supplies and equipment are fully stocked.  12 hr shifts make a great work/life balance.
cons: Lazy coworkers often sleeping in the department.  Computerized vent checks make it easier for RTs to not be on the unit.  Serious problems with management not holding senior RTs to standards.  Hostile environment if you are not from Africa or India and.  Those that care will be forced out or overworked to cover for the lazy therapists.

review_title: Poor compensation, leadership not diverse, saw a lot of nepotism in hiring. I would not recommend this place to work.
job_title: Clinical Nurse in Silver Spring, MD
pros: They do have average health care benefits and 401K
cons: Difficult for some people to advance, sort of a 'good ole boys' (except they're women, not men) type of environment with the managers. you see a lot of minorities at the lower levels--foot soldiers (nurses, nursing assistants, housekeeping, maintenance). Like to hire and promote from within, so even if you have the qualifications, it may be difficult for you to get in. Exclusive-type culture. Mgmt seems a little out of touch with how the community feels about the lack of diversity.

job_title: ICU RN in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Amazing coworkers (though they're as overworked as you are), some managers who cares (though they can't do much). An excellent learning opportunity.
cons: Horrible patient ratios throughout the entire Hospital - IMC is 5:1, medsurg 6:1, even NICU often 5:1. Poor pay. The staff is overworked so that your coworkers can't help you because the entire floor is drowning. Three patient ICU assignments are a daily occurrence. Doctors provide little information to families, leaving them in the dark. No aides on the unit.

review_title: Great ED Staff HORRIBLE MANAGEMENT IN Security Department

job_title: Registered Nurse in Silver Spring, MD
pros: I was able to get Emergency Room experience.
cons: That place is the worst and management don’t care about their staff. I’ve worked many places and never been treated the way I’ve been treated to at holy cross. It’s like a cult they want you to work what they want you to work even though you put in a schedule. I have a life outside of holy cross and I got a $6 pay increase working on staff. If you haven’t worked anywhere else you wouldn’t know any better. All they going to do is replace you and me with a new nurse who they won’t have to pay much.

review_title: It's all about the bottom dollar
job_title: Nurse in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Great benefits package. Compensation adequate.
cons: Management only cares about own image and the bottom dollar. Nurses over worked, high turnover rates, schedule/shift options limited. Also more about the money than the patient. Doctors are rude. Only cost of living adjustment. Pay rises only if you work harder to climb the clinical ladder...more certifications, participation in committees, charge nurse, continuing education, etc...does not appear to be merit based.

job_title: Community Health Worker in Silver Spring, MD
pros: Friendly co-workers, building always clean, flexibility, and overall positive experience.
cons: Employee health ladies do not listen and think they know everything. I think they forget that everyone working there has some type of health or public health background. I test positive for TB skin test and told them.  Instead of believing me and just allowing me to take an x-ray, they forced me to take the skin test which was very painful because of the reaction.
